str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
One bound, a prisoner. From desmon; a captive.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To suffer hardships together with. From sun and kakopatheo; to suffer hardship in company with.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
